planets.name: Mercury
planets.description: The smallest planet in our solar system and the closest to the Sun. Mercury has extreme temperature variations and no atmosphere.

planets.name: Venus
planets.description: The hottest planet in our solar system due to its thick atmosphere. Often called Earth's twin due to similar size.

planets.name: Earth
planets.description: Our home planet, the only known planet with life. Has liquid water, a protective atmosphere, and a magnetic field.

planets.name: Mars
planets.description: The Red Planet, known for its reddish appearance due to iron oxide on its surface. Has polar ice caps and evidence of ancient water.

planets.name: Jupiter
planets.description: The largest planet in our solar system. A gas giant with a Great Red Spot storm and over 80 moons.

planets.name: Saturn
planets.description: Famous for its prominent ring system made of ice and rock particles. Has a density less than water.

planets.name: Uranus
planets.description: An ice giant that rotates on its side. Has a unique tilted magnetic field and faint rings.

planets.name: Neptune
planets.description: The windiest planet in our solar system with speeds up to 2,100 km/h. Deep blue color due to methane in its atmosphere.
